fullText: While Lloyd Webber's music lacks the distinctive melodic stamp of his finest work, it's tuneful and energetic, blending satisfying classic rock elements with more traditional Broadway sounds.
dtliExcerpt: While Lloyd Webber's music lacks the distinctive melodic stamp of his finest work, it's tuneful and energetic, blending satisfying classic rock elements with more traditional Broadway sounds.
bwwExcerpt: Led by the hilarious Alex Brightman in a star-making performance that genuflects to Jack Black in the movie while putting his own anarchic stamp on the role of Dewey Finn, the show knows full well that its prime asset is the cast of ridiculously talented kids, ranging in age from nine to 13. They supply a joyous blast of defiant analog vitality in a manufactured digital world... It might sound lame to suggest that School of Rock works in large part because of the charms of a bunch of adorable kids.
showScoreExcerpt: While Lloyd Webber's music lacks the distinctive melodic stamp of his finest work, it's tuneful and energetic, blending satisfying classic rock elements with more traditional Broadway sounds.
